definitions.definition: a number of things of the same type which are growing or fastened together

examples.text: She picked me a **bunch of flowers**.
She put all the flowers together in one big bunch.

definitions.definition: a large amount of something; a large number of things or people

examples.text: I have **a whole bunch of** stuff to do this morning.
The people that I work with are a great bunch.
They're a great bunch of people/guys/kids.
They are a bunch of amateurs.
He's been hanging out with a bunch of yobs and hooligans.
The members were a genuinely friendly and open bunch.
They're a lovely bunch of youngsters.

definitions.definition: long hair that is divided in two and tied at each side of the head

examples.text: She wore her hair in bunches.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that is a little better than the rest of a group, although none are very good
the best out of a group of people or things
to become angry, confused or upset

wordOrigin: late Middle English: of unknown origin.
